newsitem.title: USA: Sheldahl Q3 hurt by auto strikes.
newsitem.headline: Sheldahl Q3 hurt by auto strikes.

text.p: Sheldahl Inc, which earlier reported a loss for its fiscal third quarter of $0.19 a share compared with a year-ago profit of $0.16, said its results were hurt by automotive industry strikes.

"Our third quarter results came in as we had anticipated in our public statement a month ago," company president James Donaghy said in a statement. "Strikes at Chrysler and General Motors, which affected our shipping schedules, and automotive model mix changes that came about as a result of lower-than- projected auto build rates, reduced our revenue by nearly $2 million."
It reported revenues for the third quarter ended May 30 of $27.6 million, down from $29.7 million a year ago.

"We have the capacity in place to make up the shortfall; the determining factor will be our customers' capacities," Donaghy said. "We anticipate that automotive work stoppages will continue into our fourth quarter, but will not have as pronounced an effect on results as they did in the third quarter."
Sheldahl makes high-density substrates, high-quality flexible printed circuitry and flexible laminates, primarily for sale to the automotive electronics and data communications markets.

"We cannot help but be disappointed in our results," Donaghy said. "However, we continue to believe that we are on course to maintain an average 25 percent annualized growth in the automotive sector, and are currently production-ready and certified to begin volume manufacturing at our Micro Products plant."
